title: Can a music artist stream their own music to make revenue? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do they own the rights to the music? Almost all label contracts stipulate that the label has sole distributorship over the sound recording. Most also contain “controlled composition” clauses, which exercise a similar control over the composition. If there aren’t any contracts, certainly the artist could build software to stream it to other people. Otherwise the label can issue DMCA takedown notices if it chooses.

Technically, you can, you just need to come up with some solid monetization model. You can charge for the stream, but will people pay for it? You can add audio ads, but will people stay then? So, again, you “can” stream but whether people will pay may depend on hundreds of different things.
